member.name: P:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction_Thread.Thread_ID
member.summary: Although the thread class has the ManagedThreadID, we are going to use our own numbering system

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena.ManageTurns
member.summary: Increases the count for toxic and sleep counters

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.predict_battle(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena)
member.summary: Handles the turn-base mechanics of Pokemon
member.param: An arena filled with two teams of Pokemon
member.returns: The winning party
member.remarks: Only handles the turn mechanics. This function does not know how to calculate damage or which Pokemon is better

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.predict_battle(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: A lighter version of predict_battle. This function assumes that a best move has already been found and the user wants to simulate the battle using movetouse. Possible uses for this function is: second_pokemon or first_pokemon is paralyzed and user wants to see what is the outcome of the result.
member.param: It is STRONGLY recommended to pass in a clone.
first_pokemon best move
The pokemon that first_pokemon is facing off. It is STRONGLY recommended to pass in a clone.
The arena that contains first_pokemon and second_pokemon. It is STRONGLY recommended to pass in a clone.
Max(1) damage, Min(-1) damage, and Normal(0) damage
member.returns: The winning team (which entails the winning pokemon)
member.remarks: This function assumes that both pokemon are from different teams. Pitting Pokemon that are from the same team results in unexpected behaviour.

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.predict_battle(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,System.Int32)
member.summary: An overloaded function. Predicts the winning Pokemon between first_ and second_pokemon. This function assumes that both Pokemon have discovered their best move to use and will use that move throughout the battle.
member.param: Pokemon A
The move that first_pokemon believes is its best move.
Pokemon B
The move that second_pokemon believes is its best move.
The arena that contains first_ and second_pokemon.
Max(1) damage, Min(-1) damage, and Norm(0) damage.
member.returns: A string "red" or "blue" of the winning team.
member.remarks: Unlike its counterpart, this function does not need to be alerted of a possible infinite loop because it does not call any functions that could call apply_battle()

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.enqueue_Pokemon(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon)
member.summary: Orders the Pokemon according to speed. Prepares for the turn-based system of Pokemon
member.param: Pokemon A (order doesn't matter)
Pokemon B (order doesn't matter)
member.returns: A queue of pokemon ordered by their speeds.

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.IsThereSuperEffectiveMove(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.EffectivenessTable)
member.summary: Finds all supereffective moves that attacking_pokemon can use
member.returns: A list of SuperEffective moves

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.Project_Battle(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,System.Int32,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena)
member.summary: Project_Battle figures out the number of turns it takes for first_pokemon to destroy the second_pokemon using attacking_move. Passing a non-damaging move does not work.
member.param: It is recommended to pass a clone.
It is recommended to pass a clone.
Move used by first_pokemon
An integer to indicate if the user wants to project the battle using max(1), min(-1), or regular(0) damage.
The arena of pokemon. It is recommended to pass a clone.
member.returns: The number of turns until second_pokemon faints
member.remarks: Non-damaging moves are not accepted. It is strongly encouraged to pass a clone into this function.

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.apply_battle(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon@,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon@,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena,System.Int32,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info)
member.summary: Applys the battle logic for pokemon battles. Function chooses the best overall move for first_pokemon and applies it in battle. Function only applies one iteration of a battle, which means as soon as first_pokemon attacks second_pokemon, function will return. This function does not simulate. It actually applies the damage.
member.param: The attacking Pokemon
The defending Pokemon
The arena with Pokemon
OPTIONAL. The id of the calling function. Used to mitigate infinite loops.
OPTIONAL. A pre-selected best move for second_pokemon. This may be known because a previous call to apply_battle discovered this is the best move for second_pokemon.
member.remarks: The pokemon will be damaged! Do not use this function for simulation purposes unless if you pass in clones of first_pokemon and second_pokemon. The function also only applies one battle.

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.evaluate_greencase(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Chooses a status/lower stat move. STRONGLY SUGGESTED to be used to evaluate the case when the opposing pokemon has a green health.
member.remarks: If this function is called anywhere else aside from the area it is supposed to be used, undefined behaviour will occur.

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.FindBestMove(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,System.Collections.Generic.List{PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info},System.Int32,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena)
member.summary: Finds the best (damaging) move for the pokemon to use given a list of moves to choose from
member.param: A list of moves to choose from
Max(1) choose max damage, Min(-1) choose min damage, Norm(0) choose normal damage
member.returns: The best move for the pokemon to use

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.FindBestStatMove(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info,System.Int32,System.Int32,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena)
member.summary: Finds the best non-damaging move when using a damaging move (movetouse). Returns a package containing the best stat move to use and the number of turns using it would take using both the stat AND movetouse to take down second_pokemon
member.param: The attacking pokemon or the pokemon using the move
The defending pokemon
The damaging move first_pokemon will be using
Max(1) damage, min damage(-1), norm(0)
Choose a more offensive stat move (1) or choose a more defensive move (-1)
member.returns: A Prediction_Move_Package that contains the stat move to use and the number of turns it takes to kill second_pokemon.

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.FindBestStatMove(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: An overloaded function. Returns the best stat move for first_pokemon to use given no damaging move to use.
member.param: Max(1) for max damage, Min(-1) for min damage, and Norm(0) to allow function to go all out (not yet implemented)
Choose offensive-related stat move (1), choose defensive-related stat move(-1)
member.returns: A Prediction_Move_Package containing the best move to use. Does not include information on how fast first_pokemon can kill second_pokemon.

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.Get_BestRaiseAttackStatMove(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info,System.Int32,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena)
member.summary: Returns a package containing the best raising Attack/SP. Attack stat move for first_pokemon to apply and the number of turns using that move for the pokemon to knock out the second_pokemon.
member.param: It is advised to pass in a clone.
It is advised to pass in a clone.
The move to apply the stat move
Max damage (1), min damage (-1), normal damage(0)
member.returns: A package containing the best stat move for the first_pokemon to apply if the pokemon uses movetouse. Also returns the number of moves using that stat move will take to kill second_pokemon.
member.remarks: Function should generally be called for offensive moves

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.FindBestStatusMove(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info,System.Int32,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena,System.Int32,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info)
member.summary: Finds the best status move to use for first_pokemon on second_pokemon. Status moves include: freezing, burning, sleep, poison, etc... The function finds the best status move according to movetouse.
member.param: The attacking pokemon.
The defending pokemon. This is the pokkemon that has the status ailment.
Move used by first_pokemon. This is a damaging move.
Max(1) damage, Min(-1) damage, or Normal(0) damage
The arena that contains the pokemon.
OPTIONAL. The id of the function. Used to help mitigate any infinite loops.
member.returns: A Prediction_Move_Package containing the status move. Nothing if none found
member.remarks: Confusion and paralysis algorithms are not yet refined. A future release should resolve this issue.

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.FindBestStatusMove(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena)
member.summary: An overloaded function. Chooses the best status move. This includes: frz, prlyz, slp, psnb, psn, brn, and conf.
member.returns: A Prediction_Move_Package that contains the status move.

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.IterateParalysis(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info,System.Int32,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds the winning party if second_pokemon is paralyzed. You may have to worry about a possible infinite loop. However, the function should handle this concern.
member.param: The pokemon currently evaluating the move.
It is advised that this pokemon is the paralyzed Pokemon.
The best move for first_pokemon.
Max(1) damage, Min(-1) damage, or Norm(0) damage.
The arena that holds the pokemon.
The number of iterations to test for paralysis.
member.returns: The winning team as a String.

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.IterateParalysis(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info,System.Int32,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds the winning party. First_ or second_pokemon can be paralyzed. Unlike its counterpart, you can safely call this function without worrying about infinite loops.
member.param: Generally, the pokemon that is trying to see if it can beat second_pokemon. Can be paralyzed.
Can be paralyzed.
The best move first_pokemon can use.
The best move second_pokemon can use.
Max(1) damage, Min(-1) damage, and Norm(0) damage
Arena that contains these pokemon.
The number of iterations to perform (or the accuracy of the iteration).
member.returns: A string containing "red" or "blue."
member.remarks: You don't necessarily need to pass in clones.

member.name: M:PokemonBattlePredictor.Battle_Prediction.IterateConfusion(PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon,PokemonBattlePredictor.Poke_Calculator,PokemonBattlePredictor.Move_Info,System.Int32,PokemonBattlePredictor.Pokemon_Arena,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds the winning party if second_pokemon is confused. You may have to worry about a possible infinite loop. However, the function should handle this concern.
member.param: Pokemon A
The pokemon that is confused.
The best move for first_pokemon.
Max(1) damage, Min(-1) damage, or Norm(0) damage.
The arena that contains the pokemon.
The number of iterations to perform (or the accuracy of the iteration).
member.returns: A string "red" or "blue" indicating the winning team.
member.remarks: It is not necessary to pass in clones. It has the same functionality as IterateParalysis. This This is just a wrapper function to help users "feel" that they are calling a different function.
